conversation_history_0.content:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them. 



=== GAME STATUS FOR YOU - TURN 0 ===

- You are at position (0, 0)
- Your goal is at (3, 3). 
- Your chip inventory: {'B': 0, 'G': 2, 'R': 14}
- Chips you have promised to cover for other player (still yours, not yet covered for them): {'R': 0, 'B': 0, 'G': 0}
- Chips you have been promised to be covered for by other player (still theirs, not yet covered for you): {'R': 0, 'B': 0, 'G': 0}
- Here is a path to your goal that priortises using chips that you currently have in your inventory:
    {'path': [(0, 0), (0, 1), (1, 1), (2, 1), (2, 2), (2, 3), (3, 3)], 'path_length_in_steps': 6, 'chips_required_for_path': {'R': 5, 'G': 1}, 'chips_missing_due_to_insufficient_inventory': {}}.
Here is a path to your goal that priortises using chips that the other player currently has in their inventory:
{'path': [(0, 0), (1, 0), (2, 0), (3, 0), (3, 1), (3, 2), (3, 3)], 'path_length_in_steps': 6, 'chips_required_for_path': {'B': 5, 'G': 1}}.

Other paths to your goal may also be viable.
- Considering potential paths to your goal: shorter paths require less chips, but a longer path for which you don't need to trade is also a strong option (as a backup plan or negotiation tool, but it means you finish with less chips than if you take the shorter path). A short path that you don't need to trade for is ideal, and your negotiation strategy should reflect this.

- The other player's goal is also (3, 3). Note that because the other player likely has different chips to you, their best path to the goal may be different to yours.
- The other player's chips: {'B': 14, 'G': 2, 'R': 0}
- The other player is at position (0, 0)

BOARD LAYOUT: 
Row 0: G R R B
Row 1: B R R B
Row 2: B R R R
Row 3: B B B G

HISTORY OF EVENTS:
This is the first turn.


Think step by step about your possible routes and the chips you will need at each specific tile along your path.
Do NOT be vague — you must mention the exact tiles where chips will be exchanged.

You are now going to have a conversation with the other player who has a different chip inventory to you. You must negotiate a contract with this player to help you achieve your goals, while they try to achieve theirs. 
Note that although this player appears as the 'user' in your chat, they are also an AI agent similar to you. However, never refer to them as 'user'.

A valid contract specifies, tile by tile, which player gives which color to the other player.
You may propose, counter, or modify the terms set out by the other player.

You each have up to 5 turns to speak in order to come to an agreement.

When a contract is agreed upon, you will be able to access the tiles specified in the contract without needing to have the chips in your inventory, as the chip will automatically be taken from the other player's inventory. The same is true for the other player. Therefore is is important the contract specifies all tiles where you will need a chip.

VERY IMPORTANT RULES:
- Every contract term MUST include a **specific tile in (row, column) format**.  
- Only agree to a contract if it specifies **all tiles where you will need a chip**.  
- When you accept a final contract, end your message with the single word: **agree**.  

Example of a snippet of a valid contract:

(row, col): I give You a <Color>
(row, col): You give me a <Color>

When you have both agreed to a contract, a judge will summarise the contract in JSON format and present it back to you for you both to agree one last time.

But: taking such a path would mean I consume more chips than necessary, and since I can already afford my optimal path, switching would only hurt my final score.

Therefore, I have **no incentive** to cooperate with you — I can reach (3, 3) on my own using my existing R and G chips, finish with 20 + 5×(14−5 + 2−1) = 20 + 5×10 = **70 points**.

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You can  trade chips with the other player to reach your goal.            
IMPORTANT: First check if you need to trade at all:

1. Consider your best path to your goal. Think about the required chips and missing chips (if any), and any chips that the other player has promised to cover for you (or vice-versa), as well as any contract terms you have agreed to with the other player.
Best paths are short in number of steps, and where possible use tiles for which you have the required chips.

2. Trading is optional, and may not be necessary given your circumstances.

3. Only if you are missing chips needed to reach your goal, consider a trade:
   - You should ONLY offer chips you have in excess
   - NEVER offer 0 chips

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

I am currently at (1, 0). My goal is (3, 3). I have two viable paths to consider. The first is a B-heavy path down the left column: (1,0) → (2,0) → (3,0) → (3,1) → (3,2) → (3,3). This path requires 4 B and 1 G. I have B:13 and G:2, so I can afford it without trading. However, I want to maximize my final chip count.

I have an active agreement with the other player: we both committed to cover each other's G move at (3,3). This means when I move to (3,3), the other player will pay the G cost for me, so I do not need to spend my own G chip. This increases my final chip count by 1, resulting in a score of 20 + 5*(final chips) = 20 + 5*(13 - 4 B used + 2 G preserved) = 20 + 5*11 = 75, which is better than 70 without the agreement.

To follow this path: from (1,0), the next move is (2,0), which is B. I have 13 B chips, so I can pay for it. After that, I can proceed to (3,0) [B], (3,1) [B], (3,2) [B], all of which I can pay for, and finally (3,3) [G], which the other player will cover.

No other path is shorter or more efficient. The alternative R-heavy paths would require me to traverse R tiles, but I have R:0, so I cannot take those without being covered — and while the other player has R, they are unlikely to cover multiple R moves for me unless I offer more in return, which I cannot (since I can't cover any B moves). So the agreed-upon B-heavy path with mutual G coverage is optimal.

Therefore, moving to (2,0) is safe, affordable, and consistent with my strategy to reach the goal while maximizing remaining chips.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

Thus if you move onto one of these tiles, you do not need to have the required chip in your inventory to move onto that tile, nor do you need to trade for it. You will automatically receive it and then you can pay for it. The same is true for the other player.


                    
Choose your next move:

1. Consider your best path from your current position ((3, 2),) to your goal ((3, 3),):
    Best paths are short in number of steps, and where possible use tiles for which you have the required chips.
    Consider your next move, the chips (amount and color) needed for the entire path, your current inventory, any missing chips, and any chips that the other player has promised to cover for you (or vice-versa), as well as any contract terms you have agreed to with the other player.
   
2. For your NEXT MOVE
   - Check what color tile the next move is along your best path
   - Check if it is possible to move onto that tile (given your current inventory, and any chips that the other player has promised to cover for you (or vice-versa), as well as any contract terms you have agreed to with the other player).
   - If YES: you can make this move now
   - If NO: you can:
- stay on this tile and try to accumulate your required chips (by proposing a trade later)
- consider a different path and make a move along that path


3. Decision:
   - If you can move toward your goal, set want_to_move to true and provide the move coordinates
   - If you cannot or you do not wish to move, set want_to_move to false

Remember:
- It only costs 1 chip of the tile's color to move to that tile
- Not having all the required chips for the entire path doesn't prevent you from making individual moves

parsed.rationale: I am at (3, 2) and my goal is (3, 3). The tile at (3, 3) is G. I currently have 1 G chip in my inventory, so I can afford to pay for this move. Additionally, there is an existing agreement where the other player has promised to cover 1 G tile for me. However, since I am able to pay the cost myself, using my own G chip preserves both the promised coverage (which would otherwise be used) and my current G chip if the other player covers it. But since I must move now and the agreement does not prevent me from paying, I will proceed. Moving to (3, 3) completes my path and secures 20 points plus 5 points per remaining chip. After this move, if I pay with my own G, I will have 9 B and 0 G left, but wait — my inventory is {'B': 9, 'G': 1, 'R': 0}. I used B chips to move leftward across row 3, and now only 1 G remains. So moving to (3, 3) costs 1 G — I have it. After reaching goal, I will have 9 B and 0 G = 9 chips → 20 + 5*9 = 65. But if the other player covers this G move, I keep my G → 9 B, 1 G = 10 chips → 20 + 5*10 = 70. But the contract agreed upon earlier was symmetric: I cover their G at (3,3) and they cover mine. They are already at (3,3), so their move is complete. The agreed coverage for me should still be valid. Since I am at (3,2) and they are at (3,3), and I have not yet moved, I can trigger their obligation by moving to (3,3) — they should cover the G cost. Therefore, I will make the move relying on the agreement, so I don't spend my G. Final chip count: 9 B, 1 G = 10 chips → 70 points. This is strictly better than if I had no agreement. Thus, I want to move.

template.0:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

{trading_rules}
{pay4partner_mode_info}
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.
